intro: Dalechampia longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed dalechampia, is a herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and specialized floral structures. The plant is characterized by its elongated, cylindrical stems that can grow up to several meters in length. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Dalechampia longipes is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
